rare.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: not seen or found very often, or not happening very often
rare.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: This species of plant is becoming increasingly rare.
I only saw Helen on the rare occasions when I went into her shop.
It is rare to find such an interesting group of people.
it is rare (for somebody/something) to do something
It is very rare for her to miss a day at school.
it is rare (for somebody/something) to do something
rare.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: meat that is rare has only been cooked for a short time and is still red
rare.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: We had a rare old time at the party.
rare.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: not existing in large numbers or in large amounts
The law prevents the export of rare birds.
The plates are quite rare. Only about a hundred were made.
scarce
not available in large enough numbers or amounts at a particular time – used especially about things people need
After the war, food and clothing were scarce.
People are having to compete for scarce resources.
not common
fairly rare
Silver coins of this period are not common, and could be very valuable.
infrequent
not happening often
As time went on, her visits became more and more infrequent.
be few and far between
to not be common – especially much less common than you might expect
Luckily, accidents such as these are few and far between.
Bargains are, unfortunately, few and far between.
be (something of) a rarity
if something or someone  is a rarity, it is surprising to find one, because very few exist
Women are still something of a rarity in senior management positions.
be like hen’s teeth
to be extremely rare
Good Greek restaurants are like hen’s teeth around here.
